title: ITIL Framework Structure (v1-v3)
description: Hierarchical structure of ITIL showing Service Support, Service Delivery, and Configuration Management relationships with the CMDB

processes.name: Incident Management
processes.description: Restores normal service operation as quickly as possible and minimizes adverse impact on business operations

processes.name: Problem Management
processes.description: Minimizes adverse impact of incidents and problems caused by errors within the IT infrastructure

processes.name: Change Management
processes.description: Ensures that standardized methods and procedures are used for efficient handling of all changes

processes.name: Release Management
processes.description: Takes a holistic view of changes to IT services, ensuring all aspects are considered together

processes.name: Configuration Management
processes.description: Maintains information about Configuration Items (CIs) required to deliver an IT service

processes.name: Service Level Management
processes.description: Negotiates, agrees, and monitors service level agreements with customers and suppliers

processes.name: Capacity Management
processes.description: Ensures IT infrastructure capabilities meet agreed service level targets in a cost-effective manner

processes.name: Availability Management
processes.description: Defines, analyzes, plans, measures and improves all aspects of service availability

processes.name: IT Service Continuity Management
processes.description: Supports business continuity management by ensuring IT services can be recovered within required timescales

processes.name: Financial Management
processes.description: Provides cost-effective stewardship of IT assets and resources used in providing IT services

cmdb.title: Configuration Management Database (CMDB)
cmdb.label: Authoritative Source of Truth
cmdb.description: Central repository that stores information about all Configuration Items (CIs) and their relationships, providing a single source of truth for the IT infrastructure
